item.title: Git Risky Using git metadata to predict code bug risk
item.description:
Description

Git is a powerful tool for code versioning. If you follow its best practices and have good ‘commit hygiene’ it can also be a source of valuable data about your coding practices. In this talk I’ll describe a system we built at Civis that uses the metadata git collects, along with its logging and ‘blaming’ functionality to score commits in real time on their likelihood of introducing a bug.
item.dc:creator: J. Henry Hinnefeld

item.title: High Frequency Trading in MMORPG Markets using Luigi, Pandas, and Scikit learn
item.description:
Description

PyData Chicago 2016

In this talk I’ll describe the system I developed to implement a basic algorithmic trading strategy in the in-game market of an online, multi-player video game. Using this toy model, I’ll walk through the steps involved in setting up a data pipeline with Luigi, analyzing the resulting data with pandas, and identifying important factors and features with scikit-learn.
item.dc:creator: J. Henry Hinnefeld
